intro: Struthanthus podopterus, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Morning glory family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Struthanthus podopterus is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert ecosystems.
